intro: Beccarinda tonkinensis, commonly known as the Tonkin beccarinda, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
